meanings.definition: The act of certifying a document with a notary's signature.
meanings.sent1: The notarization of the will made it legally valid.
meanings.sent2: She needed notarization on the contract before it could be official.
meanings.sent3: The notarization of the birthday card added a touch of formality to the occasion.
meanings.sent4: His notarization of the agreement was like putting a seal of approval on it.
meanings.sent5: The notarization of the deed ensured its authenticity beyond doubt.

meanings.definition: The process of verifying the authenticity of a signature on a document.
meanings.sent1: Notarization is crucial to prevent fraud in important papers.
meanings.sent2: The notarization of the contract confirmed the identity of the signatory.
meanings.sent3: The notarization process felt like a secret handshake between the parties involved.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous notarization revealed any attempts at forgery.
meanings.sent5: The notarization acted as a guardian, protecting the document from tampering.
